snippet: The leader of the United Methodist Church in New York essentially freed ministers to conduct the still-prohibited ceremony and dropped charges in one case.
abstract: Bishop Martin D McLee, head of the United Methodist Church in New York, commits to ending church trials in his region for ministers who perform same sex-marriages; move essentially frees ministers to conduct a ceremony still prohibited under his denomination’s laws; McLee has become a leading figure in a decades-old movement to extend equal recognition and rights to gay and lesbian members.
lead_paragraph: The leader of the United Methodist Church in New York essentially freed ministers to conduct the still-prohibited ceremony and dropped charges in one case.

headline.main: Methodist Bishop to End Trials for Ministers Who Perform Gay Weddings
